description: From Latin vīs (vīs has a hidden "r" that shows in forms such as the genitive plural, vīrium).

entries.meaning: (mechanics) Of or pertaining to the interactive forces between molecules or particles
(mechanics) Half of the product of the stress of attraction or repulsion with the distance between two particles.
examples: The quantity 1/2 Rr, or half the product of the attraction into the distance across which the attraction is exerted, is defined by Clausis [Prof. Clausis of Bonn] as the virial of the attraction. (In the case of pressure or repulsion, the virial is negative.)
